Mission, Vision, & VALUES

​


OUR MISSION STATEMENT


The mission of His Hands and Feet Ministries is to preach the Gospel of Jesus by being disciples who address the physical and spiritual needs of the communities we serve.


OUR VISION STATEMENT


His Hands and Feet Ministries seeks to end the cycle of poverty in Appalachia by meeting the physical and spiritual needs of those we serve.


OUR VALUE STATEMENTS


FAITH


As faithful servants of Jesus we share our faith with the residents of the communities we serve and with the volunteers who join us in service.


CHARITY


We will be the hands and feet of Jesus as we provide home repairs and other needed services to clients in need at little to no cost.


COMMUNITY


As a community of servants, we partner with individuals, charities, and other ministries in communities surrounding the clients we serve.


RESPECT  


We will interact with clients in a manner that helps them retain / maintain their dignity.



RESPONSIBILITY  


As faithful servants, we will act on our Christian responsibility to show the love of Jesus to our fellow man through our ministries.

future programS

current program

​




​home repairs


about the program:


Q:  What is the program?

A:  Volunteers travel to the communities we        work in and complete home repairs to those who need them.


Q:  What kind of "repairs" are done?

A:  Any repair that is needed to make the              home safe and accessible.  This includes        building wheelchair ramps, emergency exits, door and window repair, floor repair, roofing, etc. 


Q:  ​What skills are needed?

A:  No skills are needed. 


Q:  How old do you have to be to                       participate?

A:  Entering high school (we realize that there      will be other circumstances, so just ask us!!)


Q:  How are jobs chosen?  

A:  People who need help complete an                 application.  They provide information that proves that they are low-income and have repairs that need done.  HHFM then reviews the applications and determines if we can help them.


Q:  How do I get involved?

A:
